intro: Melanthium aspericaule, commonly known as the rough-flowered false nettle, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. Melanthium aspericaule is often found in rich, organic soils and can thrive in partial to full shade.
